Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: Electrolyte is the key component and determines the working temperature.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: In this paper, ceria and scandia co-doped zirconia electrolytes sintered from 1300 to 1550 degrees C were chosen as research objects.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: Scanning electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction and transmission electron microscopy were performed to characterize the ceramic samples.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: The effects of grain size and grain boundary element segregation on the electrical conductivity were focused.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy was used to calculate the bulk, grain boundary and specific grain boundary conductivity.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: Results show that the bulk and grain boundary ionic conductivity increases with the increasing grain size.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: However, the specific grain boundary conductivity decreases with the increasing grain size.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation and its influences on ionic conduction properties of scandia doped zirconia electrolytes

Sentencas: This is explained by the fact that Sc3+ is segregated at the grain boundary, which leads to higher oxygen vacancy concentration when sintered at lower temperature.
